questions.question: According to scientific theory, what has happened to matter in the universe since the Big Bang?

choices.answer: Matter has moved from one end of the universe to another
Matter has been stable and unmoving ever since
Matter has moved outward and collected into galaxies
Matter is contracting and coming back together again

questions.question: How would an astronomer explain the difference between the two spectra?

choices.answer: Hydrogen gives off light differently if star is more distant
The star is traveling away from us, stretching light waves
Light traveling through space is warped by the vacuum
The star is fusing a different kind of hydrogen than the sun

questions.question: How would the spectrum of hydrogen on the distant star be described?

choices.answer: Offset
Refracted
Reflected
Red-shifted

questions.question: Where did the heavy elements that make up Earth come from?

choices.answer: colliding asteroids
evaporating comets
fusion in stars
other planets

questions.question: Why do scientists accept the Big Bang theory?

choices.answer: it is a belief based on faith
it seems to make sense
evidence supports it
they trust other scientists

questions.question: How does Cosmic Microwave Background Radiationsupport the Big Bang theory? It is

choices.answer: the theory that has never been explained
energy left behind from the Big Bang as radiation
radiation that got moved out of the way during the Big Bang
light that has traveled to the edge of the universe

questions.question: How does the nebular theory describe the formation of the solar system?

choices.answer: A star exploded & created the planets we have today
A cloud of spinning dust and & condensed into sun & planets
An asteroid collision broke apart & became planets & sun.
Matter from the big bang were blastedinto space & formed it

questions.question: Which elements were formed in the big bang?

choices.answer: H & He
Carbon & Oxygen
Water & CO<sub>2</sub>
Nitrogen & Lithium

questions.question: What happens to the atoms of a star each time it goes through a life stage?

choices.answer: the weight of atoms decreases
the atoms change places
more atoms are formed
the atoms fuse into heavier ones

questions.question: A small star with a short lifespan will produce what types of elements?

choices.answer: elements that are lighter and smaller
elements that are mostly gases
elements that have large atomic weights
elements that are found on small planets

questions.question: All of the elements shown are found on Earth.  Where were they formed?

in Earthâ€™s core
